Subject: Re: [junit] setUp versus constructors


On 7/17/=
06, Brett L. Schuchert <schuchert@yahoo. com> wrote:
>
> Test Isolation
> a=

> The constructor is run once, setUp (or @Before) is run before each test
=
> method. If you want to make sure each test has the same setup/configurati=
on
> before the test executes, put it in setUp. If, on the other hand, you =
want
> to make sure all tests in a test case use the same values, put it in=
 the
> constructor.

Not exactly: since JUnit creates a brand new instance =
of your test class
before every test method, putting code in your construct=
or is exactly
equivalent to putting it in setUp().

-- 
C=C3=A9dric
http://=
testng. org
